CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1940, reads: "Notables Of Nation Discuss Defense Participation At Hampton Conference - Approximately 350 white and colored leaders gathered at Hampton institute last Monday and Tuesday for the inauguration of Hampton's sixth president, Dr. Malcolm MacLean, and to take part in Conference for the Participation of Negroes in National Defense. Defense activity was divided into 11 sections.  Some of those who made contributions to the discussions, caught by Staff Photographer Harris, are shown above....9. More conference members take a bite.  Left to right: George Murphy, secretary of the Afro-American papers; Col. West Hamilton, Washington, D.C.; Major Campbell Johnson, Washington, D.C.; Dr. Chas. S. Johnson, Fisk University, and Dr. Charles Thompson, Howard University"
TitMainTitle: Group of men from left: George Murphy, Col. West Hamilton, Major Campbell Johnson, Dr. Chas. S. Johnson, and Dr. Charles Thompson, dining at circular table in interior at Hampton Institute
